project.teaser: xShare envisions everyone sharing their health data in EEHRxF with a click-of-a-button. The xShare button to be featured across health portals and patient apps and allow people to exercise their data portability rights under GDPR. Hence, the European EHRxF will be the driver...
project.objective: xShare envisions everyone sharing their health data in EEHRxF with a click-of-a-button. The xShare button to be featured across health portals and patient apps and allow people to exercise their data portability rights under GDPR. Hence, the European EHRxF will be the driver for research and innovation in EHDS. xShare will establish the European EHRxF Standards and Policy Hub, the “Hub” partnership of six standards developing organizations (CEN/TC251, HL7 Europe, IHE Europe, SNOMED, CDISC, IEEE) market actors (DIGITAL Europe, MedTech-Europe and EUCROF), supported by competence centers, nationals and regional authorities and European SMEs. xShare will develop: 1) Harmonized common specifications, create and maintain xBundles i.e., collection of common data specifications including FHIR implementation guides, tools and data sets, and educational support for key EHRxF health information domains as noted in the EHDS draft regulation Annex 1. 2) A set of common elements across EHRxF health information domains applicable across EHDS-1 (JA-9), public/population health (EHDS-2), and clinical research. 3) Extended harmonized IPS specification to include care plans and making it fit for the purpose of clinical research use cases i.e. clinical trial eligibility, real world data, patient reported outcomes, and returning clinical research data to patients. 4) xShare feature the xShare Button in 8 adoption settings in Hospital network (Italy), National portal (Greece, Ireland, Cyprus), regional network with emphasis in medical tourism and the connection of the public to the private sector (Catalunya and Madeira), entry of digital health applications to the myHealthSpace ecosystem in France. Care plans will be demonstrated in Denmark. xShare investigate the feasibility and value of the EU xShare Industry label as a vehicle towards implementing the draft EHDS regulation. Lastly open calls at the last year of the project aim to onboard with EHRxF almost 100 settings across Europe.
project.title: Expanding the European EHRxF to share and effectively use health data within the EHDS
project.keywords: Expansion of European EHRxF, European Health Data Space, Trusted Data Sharing, Interoperability, Health Data Portability, Standardisation, Primary and Secondary Use of Data, Harmonisation of Formats

article.title: A European prescription to solve healthcare’s data dilemma"

result.title: Monitoring framework on national EEHRxF uptake and EHRxF Standards Hub performance - 1
result.description: Sets out the framework with indicators to monitor the EEHRxF adoption within Member States, as well as the performance of the EHRxF Standards Hub

result.title: Towards EHDS Compliance in Europe to Support Public Health

details.authors: Eugenia Rinaldi, Luc Nicolas, Nienke Schutte, Sasha Milbeck, Sylvia Thun, Catherine Chronaki
details.journalTitle: Studies in Health Technology and Informatics, Intelligent Health Systems – From Technology to Data and Knowledge

result.title: Project Handbook & Quality Plan
result.description: Project method for planning and coordinating project activities according to the project’s obligations and requirements. A dedicated section on the quality plan and associated procedures for reporting in a qualitative way will be included

result.title: Proposed interoperability specification for an International Patient Summary for Research mapped to international standards - 1
result.description: An interoperability specification for an International Patient Summary for Research (IPS-R) mapped to international standards will be proposed

result.title: Standards in sync: five principles to achieve semantic interoperability for TRUE research for healthcare

details.authors: Rhonda Facile, Catherine Chronaki, Peter van Reusel, Rebecca Kush

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: It shall be focused on the different data to be gathered. It shall cover topics like: (1) information about the data and data format, (2) metadata content and format, (3) policies for access, sharing and re-use and (4) long-term storage and data management.

result.title: X-Bundles for HIDs in selected Business use cases - 1
result.description: Open collections of common content specifications, common service components, adoption support components organized by HID and Business case and linked to the business use case registry.

result.title: xSHARE Communication, Dissemination and Stakeholder Engagement Plan - 1
result.description: The first document outlining the plan for Communication, Dissemination and Stakeholder engagement activities. The deliverable is updated during the project to align with the needs of the project and stakeholders.

result.title: xShare Data portability business use cases, validation process, and localization requirements - Final
result.description: This deliverable will document of the co-creation process run between the 8 adoption sites/settings and the European Standards and Policy Hub that will specify how the rights of citizens on portability of their health data under GDPR is made a reality.

result.title: Annual EHRxF Standards Hub Work Plans - Y2
result.description: This document details the activities to be undertaken by the Hub, as well as a review of the activities carried out in the previous period. (T2.1) It will include updated collaboration guidelines with the industry (contribution from DE/MedTec) and regulators (Contribution MoH-NL, ISCTE) to facilitate open collaboration with industry organisationsand regulators that allows for the exchange of best practices, examples and used tools (T2.4)

result.title: Business Use Case Registry
result.description: An open registry of business use case descriptions and associated requirements will be made available for public information, considering the eStandards use case repository (T2.2)

result.title: The industry xShare label
result.description: The report will consider the status of the EHDS regulation and Art 23, and consider the case for an xShare label to demonstrate compliance with the EEHRxF

result.title: Public health Threads: state of the art, needs analysis and use cases
result.description: This report will provide an overview on what has been achieved so far on the different public/population health priorities at Member State, Europe, and Globally. Based on needs and gaps identified a priority list of business use cases and data sets will be prepared

result.title: Proposal for a harmonized core data set across health care, population health and clinical research.
result.description: An initial analysis of core data elements will be performed to select a subset that should be harmonized across the domains of healthcare, population health and clinical research

result.title: xSHARE Communication, Dissemination, Stakeholder Engagement Plan - 2
result.description: The second document outlining the plan for Communication, Dissemination and Stakeholder engagement activities. The deliverable is updated during the project to align with the needs of the project and stakeholders.

result.title: EHRxF in a nutshell
result.description: This introduction to the EHRxF will educate the interested reader in the proposed way in which the EHRxF can transform the delivery of care and the role of the patient (T2.2)

result.title: xSHARE Website
result.description: The website of the project, constituting the main platform for the external communication and presentation of the project results

result.title: Analysis of business use cases for use of EHRxF HIDs in clinical research
result.description: Business use cases will be analysed o with focus to real-world data items of greatest value to clinical research and proposals for a research extension to the IPS (IPS-R)

result.title: "Quarterly Multimedia Newsletter ""in the hub"""
result.description: The multimedia newsletter will report on xSHARE activities to multistakeholder EEHRxF Community of Excellence (T8.3)

result.title: The vision for a xShare label: liberating Health data
result.description: Initially a vision for the label’s potential as an assurance mark for citizens and patients to easily share personal health data

result.title: xShare toolbox for data portability under GDPR - Interim 2
result.description: This deliverable will report on the developments of the xShare toolbox for data transformation, pheudonymization data donation from UNINOVA, FORTH, GNOMON and other SMEs wishing to contribute to the Hub, the toolbox will be delivered to the Hub

result.title: xShare Data portability business use cases, validation process, and localization requirements - Interim
result.description: This deliverable will document of the co-creation process run between the 8 adoption sites/settings and the European Standards and Policy Hub that will specify how the rights of citizens on portability of their health data under GDPR is made a reality.

result.title: xShare Communication, Dissemination and Stakeholder Engagement Report - 1
result.description: The first report documenting and evaluating the Communication, Dissemination, Stakeholder engagement and exploitation activities. It will provide suggestions for the communication, dissemination and stakeholder engagement activities, as well as input into the Exploitation plan & Market Analysis.

result.title: Charter of the European EHRxF Standards Hub
result.description: This document marks the official start of the Hub and should have the endorsement of the key stakeholders. (T2.1)

result.title: X-Bundles for HIDs in selected Business use cases - 2
result.description: Open collections of common content specifications, common service components, adoption support components organized by HID and Business case and linked to the business use case registry.

result.title: xShare Button Demonstrators - Interim 1
result.description: This deliverable will be a demonstrator of the xShare Button concept in different business settings with engagement of adoption sites to serve as guidance to the Open calls, Gnomon (IDIKA, HSE), TicSalut, TTSA, FTGM, and UCY, SRS will contribute.

result.title: Public health data sets harmonized with EHRxF HIDs - 1
result.description: Harmonised data sets will be delivered based on the selected focus areas

result.title: xShare toolbox for data portability under GDPR - Interim 1
result.description: This deliverable will report on the developments of the xShare toolbox for data transformation, pheudonymization data donation from UNINOVA, FORTH, GNOMON and other SMEs wishing to contribute to the Hub, the toolbox will be delivered to the Hub

result.title: Annual EHRxF Standards Hub Work Plans -Y1
result.description: This document details the activities to be undertaken by the Hub, as well as a review of the activities carried out in the previous period. (T2.1) It will include updated collaboration guidelines with the industry (contribution from DE/MedTec) and regulators (Contribution MoH-NL, ISCTE) to facilitate open collaboration with industry organisationsand regulators that allows for the exchange of best practices, examples and used tools (T2.4)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
